title.narrative: Serving 2,600 elderly in our In-Home Care Program

description.narrative: The 2,600 elderly we serve are facing not just isolation and effects of loneliness, but many times abandonment, exacerbated by preexisting inequalities and long stories of deprivations, health problems, poverty, and social exclusion. In addition, the long coronavirus restrictions have aggravated all the above factors. Our aim is to provide them quality of life, preserving personal independence and dignified-end-of-life care. We need your help to continue assisting on this life-saving cause.

organisation.narrative: Fundacion de Beneficencia Hogar de Cristo

mailing-address.narrative: Hogar de Cristo 3812 Estacion Central Santiago 9160345 Chile

description.narrative: COVID-19 has worsened disparities found in workplaces worldwide. In the US alone, 80% of pandemic job loss has affected women, and 25% of women might reduce their hours or leave altogether. Compounding on this, minority women have had the highest rates of unemployment throughout the beginning of the pandemic. Sexism is a Goliath to tackle and can make a solution seem pretty impossible. That is where AI comes in. Simply put- our project will screen for bias and incentivize companies to do better.

mailing-address.narrative: 800 Arlington Boulevard El Cerrito, CA 94530 United States

description.narrative: In Trans Nzoia County, Kenya, KAP will enhance the emotional and social capacities of 1,358 youths (of whom 338 intensively) facing mental health challenges, in order to enable them choose healthy behaviors, especially those concerning sexual health, alcohol/substance abuse and trauma/violence prevention and management (& COVID-19). KAP does so by providing community-based training of 'Unreached Youths' Community Resource Persons and professional counselling and (psycho-) education services.

mailing-address.narrative: Immaculate Cath Cathedral, Church Road, Kitale, Kenya P.O. Box 371 Kitale, Trans Nzoia County 30200 Kenya

title.narrative: Free artistic training for 150 children in DR

description.narrative: The economic depression caused by Covid 19 has strongly affected the Dominican Republic, and there are few teachers of the arts who are willing to teach children and adolescents from impoverished communities for free or economically. Our institution has been working to revive and now protect and promote the musical arts. This project now supports up to 150 impoverished children, between the ages of 8 and 17, from the Haina and San Cristobal neighborhoods to receive free quality classes in the ar

title.narrative: Keep a Girl Child Safe and Educated in Malawi

description.narrative: A Girl Child is at risk of dropping out of school, abused and raped because of lack of academic resources, leading to early pregnancies and marriages. Malawi has registered an extremely increase (63%) in teen pregnancies and marriages especially during this period of COVID-19 pandemic. Our project aims at empowering and providing access to academic resources to the less privileged girl child learners around Ndirande community as a means to keep a girl child safe, occupied and empowered.

mailing-address.narrative: P. O. Box 60180, Blantyre,Malawi Blantyre 265 Malawi

title.narrative: Help us prevent teenage pregnancy in DR

description.narrative: In the Los Manguitos community, there are still many challenges faced by adolescent girls and young women in obtaining adequate menstrual and reproductive health and counseling services. This situation has been worsened by the COVID-19 crisis. Teen pregnancies are on the rise. With this project the Foundation intends to improve its sexual, reproductive and menstrual health services for its more than 200 young women to include: weekly health text messages; monthly access to pregnancy tests; acces

organisation.narrative: Community Foundation in Favor of Single Mothers and Young Unprotected Funcomas RNC. 430024882

title.narrative: United Against Hunger in the Rio Grande Valley

description.narrative: COVID-19 is more than a viral pandemic in the Rio Grande Valley of Texas. It is an economic crisis affecting a disproportionate percentage of our population. The Rio Grande Valley is one of the poorest places in the U.S. The safety net isn't large enough or sturdy enough to support all of those who are suffering from food insecurity stemming from record unemployment levels. We are distributing lots of food. And we're hiring furloughed food service workers to help us do it more efficiently.

organisation.narrative: United Way of Southern Cameron County

mailing-address.narrative: 634 E Levee St Brownsville, TX 78520 United States

title.narrative: Provide 500 At-Risk Youth with Education Services

description.narrative: Pandemic Professors offers individualized education services to at-risk youth. We pledge to fight the effects of the growing inequalities caused from COVID-19 and school closures. We provide 1:1 tutoring services, as well as ESL tra, financial literacy, coding tutoring, and socioemotional support. We have served over 250 students in 20 states, and we are dedicated to serving more students in need, with the ultimate goal of closing the education gap caused by socioeconomic and racial disparities.

mailing-address.narrative: 512 W 156th St Apt 22 New York, NY 10032 United States

title.narrative: Grow brighter futures for 220 Guatemalan children

description.narrative: The Covid Adaptation Fund will offset the rising costs of our hybrid preschool program. Students are coming to school in small 4-person groups twice a week, and their parents facilitate the rest of the activities at home. This fund will help us provide phone data for children to communicate with teachers, safe transportation for in-person classes, training for parents, a book-lending program, cleaning supplies, and an emergency food bank for the most vulnerable families.

mailing-address.narrative: 2860 Weller Ln Northbrook, IL 60062 United States

title.narrative: Restoring rights of 60 children in San Salvador

description.narrative: As Fundacion Viva Juntos por la ninez El Salvador we are working on a project aimed at restoring the limitation of children's rights exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic, which has caused severe damage to mental and physical health, access education, malnutrition and food insecurity, as well as limited recreational spaces. That is why friendly spaces for learning, integration and play are being created for the children of communities and markets of San Salvador, restoring their rights.

organisation.narrative: Fundacion Viva Juntos por la Ninez El Salvador

mailing-address.narrative: Residencial San Luis, block 3 calle Las Violetas, casa 37-A San Salvador, San Salvador 1101 El Salvador

title.narrative: Give an education to 100 teenage mothers in Ghana

description.narrative: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic resulting in closure of schools, lots of school going girls in rural Ghana have become pregnant and if nothing is done immediately to send them back to school, they would be married off and have their lives destroyed. This project seeks to support 100 teenage mothers in rural Ghana go back to school to acquire secondary or vocational/technical education. The project will give scholarships to these girls to enable them go back and stay in school till completion.

mailing-address.narrative: Off the Tender Care School, Banja Street, Wa Wa, Upper West Region P O Box 344, Wa Ghana

The unreached and people living under poverty are the focus of this Appeal. COVID enters through 1 person and usually affects everyone at home; disrupting the complete livelihood chain and putting all family at risk . The total cases in Pakistan reaches to 637,042 and total deaths so far are 13,965. We need to STANDING NEXT TO THOSE STAND ALONE1111

title.narrative: Relief Hub for families of COVID-19 victims

description.narrative: Covid-19 has had a tremendous impact on people ranging from children, young people, adults, parents and the elderly, some of whom have lost a spouse, family member or loved one. Nurturing Foundations plans to provide a hub where children will have access to books and STEM materials to promote their creativity and innovation and also provide support, information and resources to adults and families of the victims of the pandemic ensuring that they live happier and healthier lives going forward.

mailing-address.narrative: Harpurhey Neighbourhood Project Carisbrook Street, Harpurhey Manchester M9 5UX United Kingdom

title.narrative: Jookender Family Camp September 2021 Boston, MA

description.narrative: This project helps to build a vibrant and diverse community of 1st generation Russian Speaking Jewish Refugee families to the United States and rekindle their Jewish identity, connect Teens through generations, and overall increase the health and well-being of this highly underserved community, especially, right after the COVID ease, when many families are left without employment and the ability to provide their children with proper educational and emotional care.

organisation.narrative: Jookender Community Initiatives, Inc. A Non-Profit

mailing-address.narrative: 945 Concord St. Framingham, MA 01701 United States

title.narrative: Empower Students with Life-Changing Skills, Kenya

description.narrative: Have you ever considered how technical skills such as metalwork, hairdressing, or electrical installation can change someone's life? At the Mabati Technical Training Institute, our students are able to learn these, alongside life skills, entrepreneurship & IT skills to earn a decent income. Ever since Covid-19 came along, our students aren't able to afford the training fees and risk dropping out. Support our project and empower our vulnerable students to lead better lives.

mailing-address.narrative: 4TH FLOOR PARK PLACE LIMURU ROAD P.O. BOX 46934 - 00100 NAIROBI NAIROBI, KENYA 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Give School Supplies To 600 Disadvantaged Students

description.narrative: The African proverb, "It takes a village to raise a child," is how TGER works with communities to improve children's lives.The civil war, Ebola, and COVID devastated Liberia's children. There is a shortage of schools, skilled teachers, school equipment, and supplies. TGER provides school supplies and equipment, uniforms, food and clothing. We pay for school repairs and related infrastructure. Donating to TGER will enrich the students, parents and communities.

mailing-address.narrative: 8340 New Second St. Elkins Park, PA 19027 United States

description.narrative: This project will provide food, Sanitary towels, inner wears, Hygiene items, hand washing Systems,face mask, build empowerment center, training, clean water, guidance and counselling to 1500 Orphan and Vulnerable children subjected sexual abuse,child labour and psychological stress in Kenya. The emergence of COVID-19 has compelled impoverished girls to indulge in sex in exchange for food, sanitary towels resulting to child pregnancies and child marriages, STIs and HIV/AIDs infections.

organisation.narrative: HAPPY KENYA COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATION(HAPPY KENYA)

Hiyaw Fikir Planned to make health screening of all the beneficiary including their families or guardians and providing access for psychiatry medical treatment by covering all medical bills

description.narrative: This project will provide education to marginalized girls who are teenage mothers in Kibera Slum, Nairobi Kenya with access to life skill development techniques, education, leadership, and Socio-economic empowerment skills. This project also seeks to raise Teen pregnancy advocates who will champion to end teenage pregnancy in the community through peer to peer mentorship program. Through the peer mentorship the projects seeks to reduce the rate of teenage pregnancy amidst COVID-19.

organisation.narrative: Agape Woman and Child Empowerment Foundation (AWOCHE)

mailing-address.narrative: 8041 00100 Nairobi 00100 Kenya

description.narrative: SOS Children's Village Macedonia plans to create "Home Educational corners" to enable 150 children to attend classes from home due to COVID 19. Coming from the poorest families, not having basic conditions for home education we will provide them with study desks, chairs, educational materials, and internet & educational support services for one year. This project will prevent these children from leaving the educational process and prevent them from living by the rules of the "street".

mailing-address.narrative: Risto Siskov 31 Skopje, Center 1000 Macedonia, Republic of

title.narrative: Avoid school dropout in children with DownSyndrome

description.narrative: The National Emergency caused by Covid 19 have prompted schools to provide care for all students virtually.This strategy has managed to mitigate the impact in terms of access to education. However, this provision fails to respond to the necessary adjustments for the population with intellectual disabilities.This project seeks virtual pedagogical support in a way that facilitates developing the academic skills required in the different grades to avoid school dropouts

mailing-address.narrative: Carrera 49 # 99 - 10 Barrio La Castellana BOGOTA, Distrito Capital de Bogota 111211 Colombia

title.narrative: Combat Corona to the Last Mile In Kenya

description.narrative: In Kenya, most people live from hand to mouth, with 40% of the people living below the poverty line and 50% just above it. For our community, staying home makes it difficult to get necessities like soap, food, and salt. This project is acting in response to the COVID outbreak or its consequences, through raising awareness about prevention, supporting vulnerable populations during the economic stop-down. MCDC plans to support 200 households to access ,food ,shelter,education and healthcare .

mailing-address.narrative: 77 Mumias -Kenya Nairobi, western /Kakamega 50102 Kenya

title.narrative: A new future for survivors of abuse, South Africa

description.narrative: Women in the poor, underserved community of Mabopane, South Africa are battling a war of gender-based violence and femicide. The "Ikemele" women empowerment project provides free skills training, counselling & practical support to help survivors of GBV rise above their circumstances & become financially independent - the key to walking away from an abusive situation. With the tragic increase in partner violence during COVID, vulnerable women need hope and a second chance more than ever before.

mailing-address.narrative: Lesedi la Batho Community Centre 3217 Block B Mabopane, Gauteng 0190 South Africa

description.narrative: The women of Vanuatu have been impacted by repeated cyclones, and covid-19, which has closed the border and stopped Vanuatu's tourism industry which accounts for 40% of the economy, and lastly to better address gender inequality in Vanuatu. Many women find themselves in dire straits financially. Women who want to overcome these challenges struggle to overcome the constraints they face.

mailing-address.narrative: 9660 Battle Point Dr NE Bainbridge Island, WA 98110 United States

title.narrative: Equip 250 girls with Reusable Sanitary Pads Skills

description.narrative: The Girl2Girl Initiative will provide hands on training to 250 adolescent girls and young teenage mothers in making Reusable Butterfly Sanitary pads for adolescent girls, women and young teenage mothers in both rural and semi-urban communities of Uganda. As the world is still struggling on containing the spread of Covid-19, many adolescent young girls in Uganda continue to face greater challenges of poor menstrual hygiene due to lack of access to free and low-cost sanitary pads.

mailing-address.narrative: Mirage Plaza, Old Port Bell Road Kampala, Central Region P.O.BOX 6982 Uganda

title.narrative: HELPING THE POOR IN BIHAR INDIA TO SURVIVE COVID

description.narrative: This project now over a year old combines many aspects of the helping the poor in dealing with the devastating consequences of the Covid 19 pandemic here in Bihar one of the poorest states in India. Our Rescue centre in Gaya became overwhelmed with requests for help as returning migrant labourers often after walking hundreds of kilometres could not feed their children. Our emergency response saved many lives. However Covid is going to be around a long time and our response needs to be too..

mailing-address.narrative: The Averill Centre Bodhgaya, Bihar 824231 India

title.narrative: Help 30 Albanian women survive a divorce

description.narrative: Albania is facing divorce in higher rate and Covid-19 pandemic made it worse. Even though in Albania family is seen as saint, numbers of divorce are growing up and women are left alone. This project will provide psychologic and economic support for 30 divorced women to recreate their life. Your donation will provide them counseling sessions with the psychologist, a rented house for at least 3 months, professional training course, daycare center and schooling for the children.

mailing-address.narrative: Pallatet Jera, Yzberisht, Ap. 5 Tirane, Tirane 1023 Albania

title.narrative: Family Futures - pathways out of extreme poverty

description.narrative: Towards preventing child labour our project will help 150 families of the children on our education programmes into sustainable income generation. Family poverty drives families into sending their children to work and COVID-19 is pushing more people into extreme poverty. We identify a suitable enterprise, contribute a micro grant to get it off the ground and embed business support to ensure success. This is underpinned with social and welfare support to safeguard the education of their children.

mailing-address.narrative: 19 Highbury Terrace Mews London N5 1UT London N5 1UT United Kingdom

title.narrative: Advance Economic Growth for 50 women in DR Congo

description.narrative: Amid a food security crisis & COVID-19-related lockdowns, women distillers of Rwenena, in Eastern DRC, created a plant-based hand-sanitizing gel. You can provide training and capital for this licensed & certified enterprise run by the 50-member women's cooperative, "Pama Kaci-Let's cultivate love" Donations will also fund activities that advance community-led development. This project is implemented by the Congo Federation of Smallholder Farmers Organizations of South Kivu (FOPAC-SK).

title.narrative: Empowering 25 people from Oaxaca and Hidalgo

description.narrative: This project will strengthen 25 people and young people from Oaxaca and Hidalgo, Mexico, who were economically affected by the covid-19 crisis. Unfortunately, thousands of people were affected by the situation and lost their jobs; also several micro-businesses had to close due to the sanitary measures, affecting entrepreneurs. We will strengthen and encourage them with business knowledge, so they could start or improve a microenterprise to recover and generate economic resources.

mailing-address.narrative: Herschel 131, Colonia Anzures Mexico 11590 Mexico

description.narrative: On April 9, the La Soufriere volcano erupted, causing the evacuation of thousands from surrounding villages in St. Vincent. We will provide immediate assistance to LGBTQ+ evacuees affected by the volcanic eruption and already battling with COVID-19 and discrimination in a region where they are criminalised. Our relief assistance will include food packages, clean water, hygiene kits, sanitary products, clothing, heavy-duty face masks, relocation and housing support.

organisation.narrative: EASTERN CARIBBEAN ALLIANCE FOR DIVERSITY AND EQUALITY (ECADE)

description.narrative: THET has supported Myanmar health workers for over 7 years. COVID-19 and the recent coup have placed them under unprecedented pressure, resulting in an increased demand for training and information exchange with their counterparts in the UK, particularly in the field of acute and emergency medicine. This project will strengthen the skills of Myanmar health workers and equip them with the tools to continue delivering healthcare to the communities & patients they seek to serve at a time of crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: 1 Wimpole Street London, London W1G 0AE United Kingdom

title.narrative: Provide Pandemic Relief For 500 Cambodian Families

description.narrative: At-risk youth should still have their basic needs met during Covid-19. As Cambodia faces a major outbreak, poor families are struggling to make ends meet. In April, a nighttime curfew began in Phnom Penh, and other restrictions make it harder for the poor to earn income as food vendors and day laborers. Mission Dove Cambodia will provide food and hygiene supplies to vulnerable families and at-risk youth of its learning programs and target areas in Phnom Penh city and in six other provinces.

title.narrative: Help provide PPE for paramedics in Mexico

description.narrative: Our community has been hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic and, as a response, we are providing free pre hospital emergency services to those who are suffering complications from this condition. We are committed to provide these services by implementing the highest safety standards for both, our paramedics and patients.

description.narrative: The wildlife trade is a multi-billion dollar industry that threatens endangered species' survival and human health as zoonotic diseases such as COVID-19 emerge. Bangladesh is both a wildlife source and transit country, and illegal trafficking was rampant in 2001 when the Wildlife Rapid Rescue Team (WRRT) was established to crack down on the trade. To date, WRRT has rescued over 69,000 live animals, apprehended over 7,700 traders, and confiscated large quantities of animal parts and contraband.

title.narrative: Donate health to 40 low-income Venezuelan migrant

description.narrative: Colombia registers the highest number in its history as a host country for Venezuelan immigrants. Most of them come into the country illegally, making it almost impossible to access basic healthcare among other necessities. Even though the Covid-19 crisis has worsened everyone's situation, in 2020 Patronato Foundation had 37 Venezuelan beneficiaries who received 219 health related services. Help us keep providing comprehensive health-care services, to immigrant children from Venezuela.

description.narrative: ISKCON Varanasi with the help of HOPE WELFARE TRUST is providing free meals to the family members & people waiting in queues at crematoriums/cemeteries for the last rites of the bodies of their loved ones lost to COVID-19. The second wave has hit India very badly and Varanasi is one of the top five affected cities. Currently, the waiting duration is more than 15 hours at most of the places simply to get to cremate the mortal remains of the deceased.

description.narrative: ISKCON Varanasi, with the help of UMEED & HOPE WELFARE TRUST, is trying to help poor villagers afflicted with COVID-19 in arranging for oxygen cylinders. The beds in hospitals are full and there is a scarcity of oxygen cylinders in the whole country. Several patients need oxygen provision even at their homes as they struggle to breathe & pass this tough phase.

title.narrative: Help India Fight the Unprecedented COVID Surge

The Health Center will have 100 beds and essential medical supplies like oxygen tanks, ventilators, CT-scan machine (and much more). It will save thousands of lives and help the underserved section of the society avoid succumbing to the disease.

description.narrative: Vaccinating adults in the Mumbai slums against Covid-19 is OSCAR Foundation's priority. Misinformation, fear, lack of time, loss of income & accessibility is preventing adults from low income communities taking up the vaccine. OSCAR's 'Vaccine Education & Participation' programme provides the science, the facts & the urgency. The OSCAR team will help with vaccine registration & support adults too afraid to leave their communities to travel to the vaccination centres. Read on...

title.narrative: Emergency COVID Care support in Bangalore

description.narrative: India is grappling with the apocalyptic spike that has wreaked havoc on our health care system. More than 200,000 people have lost their lives. In Bangalore, there are 300,000 infected, and around 15,000 have lost their lives. We expect the actual numbers to go up by 3 or 4 times. Lack of beds, oxygen, essential medicines and a depleted healthcare team is what we have now. Your donation will help treat, save people with COVID and slow the spread of COVID-19 in Bangalore and its rural villages.

title.narrative: India COVID 19 continuing education for children

The current wave of COVID 19 is very difficult for families, children are particularly in need. We, at Thamarai Education Projects, are committed to working towards the full potential for all. We have adapted our after-school programs to provide daily learning calls, emotional check-ins, and home drops of education supplies.

description.narrative: COVID-19 pandemic is still incredibly growing in Brazil in 2021. Urgent actions are needed to minimize social and public health negative impacts. This project is an expansion of a previous project to produce additional 15,000 handmade masks with 15 low income women. We will pay them to produce and distribute the masks along with hygiene kits (alcohol and bleach) to low income families in the states of Bahia and Sao Paulo. We will generate income and provide basic protection against coronavirus.

More than 200,000 people have died due to a second coronavirus surge in India and hundreds of thousands of people are infected each day. Many are unable to get the medical help they need. Donations to this fund will help treat patients and slow the spread of COVID-19 in India.

title.narrative: Covid-19: Aid to Slum Communities in India

Marginalized populations, mostly daily wage workers, living in the slums & villages need food & other basic needs and Vaccination to stay alive. Your donations will help distribute essential nutrition, dry ration kits, and hygiene kits to families living in slums & villages of Delhi, Haryana & Rajasthan while educating them on prevention & vaccination.

Bhumi's COVID Relief Support is aimed at connecting people in need through our volunteers and helpline with either funding support and/or people who can support them.

title.narrative: 2021 PAMA COVID-19 Urgent Relief to Palestine

description.narrative: During these uncertain and challenging times, PAMA continues to update you on the situation in Palestine. Currently, there are 163573 confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the West Bank and Gaza, and 1684 deaths cases as of 1/7/2021.We at PAMA are committed to supporting Palestine throughout this crisis and we know that you are too. We have seen how, together, PAMA and its supporters can save lives and we know we can count on you to meet this challenge with us.

The project will also support our frontline workers who have been infected with the virus while working on the ground, ensuring emergency relief to the families worst affected by lockdown. Beneficiaries will be supported across India.

title.narrative: Covid-19 Help For 50 Animal Welfare Staff In India

description.narrative: TOLFA Animal Hospital has been working to help the sick and injured animals of India for over 15 years. We have helped over 225,000 animals in this time. We wouldn't be able to do this without our incredible Indian team - 50 men and women from mostly impoverished backgrounds who support their extended families through their employment at TOLFA. As the terrifying new Covid-19 Crisis rips through India we have a duty to keep our staff safe and well. This project is to provide support for our staff

title.narrative: Protect India's children from the second wave

description.narrative: The second surge of coronavirus continues to worsen the struggles of the underserved at a faster pace compared to last year. Ground reports also suggest that one of the main, emerging worries during this second wave is the increasing number of children being affected by the virus. We at CRY, Child Rights and You, along with our project partners have assessed the situation and created an emergency plan to address the immediate health, nutrition and safety needs of children and their families.

mailing-address.narrative: 189/A, Anand Estate Sane Guruji Marg Mumbai, Maharashtra 400011 India

title.narrative: COVID-19 relief for Medical Emergencies in India

description.narrative: Agastya International foundation is committed to help its beneficiaries in these tough times. The proceedings from this fundraiser will go to helping our beneficiaries in medical emergencies, ICU care, PPE kits and home care kits in India.

mailing-address.narrative: 101, Varsav Plaza, 12 Jayamahal Main Road Bangalore, Karnataka 560046 India

title.narrative: Continuing education for children during COVID-19

description.narrative: Agastya International Foundation is creating a self learning education kit for the underprivileged children in India. With significant learning loss for especially those without access to technology (75% of underprivileged children), an opportunity to learn creatively (do, question, observe, explore and experiment) at home. Aha Book is a powerful, low cost "creative maker book" that promotes self learning anywhere, anytime.

mailing-address.narrative: 101, Varsav Plaza, 12 Jayamahal Main Road Bangalore, Karnataka 560046 India

title.narrative: Food Security for 115 Families in COVID-hit Pune

description.narrative: The Waghri and Sikligar communities are Denotified Tribal (DNT) communities residing in several slums in urban Pune, India. These families, already extremely economically and socially marginalized, have been unable to work due to the devastating COVID-19 pandemic, and desperately need food ration support to make it through this crisis. Ashraya Initiative for Children will provide food and sanitary supplies to the 115 families in these communities to help them through the pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: 9 Sparrow Crest % Elizabeth Sholtys Ithaca, New York 14850 United States

title.narrative: Emergency Response to COVID-19 Surge in India

description.narrative: India is currently fighting a wave of COVID-19 that is sickening hundreds of thousands each day and is killing thousands. The situation is extremely serious, with more than 18.4 million confirmed COVID-19 cases and more than 205,000 confirmed deaths as of April 29, 2021. At the current rate of infection, it is projected that nearly 960,000 people in India will die from the disease. International Medical Corps is activating our emergency response to address the dire situation.

mailing-address.narrative: 12400 Wilshire Blvd. Suite 1500 Los Angeles, CA 90025 United States

title.narrative: Vaccinate & stop spread of COVID IInd wave-India

description.narrative: Vaccination, Oxygen & educating our communities about sanitizing, mask and keeping social distance against spread of Covid-19 is CHHASE priority. We will remove Misunderstanding, fear, confusion; loss of income is preventing our community taking up the vaccine. We educate the urgency & facts about vaccination and to encourage vaccination, we will provide transportation to the vaccination centres & return them safely and we will provide food groceries to people, who suffer due to COVID 2nd wave.

organisation.narrative: Community Health, Housing and Social Education (CHHASE)

mailing-address.narrative: Thomiar St Pannur Vil & Post Tiruvallur District, Tamilnadu 602108 India

title.narrative: Bring Youth Baseball Back to Abaco

description.narrative: Hurricane Dorian, the most destructive hurricane in the history of The Bahamas, wreaked unimaginable devastation on Great Abaco Island in 2019. COVID 19 brought even more challenges to a community that is struggling to rebuild. We are providing gloves, bats, and helmets for the boys and girls of Abaco, and raising money to restore the baseball/softball field at Central Abaco High School. Practices and conditioning have already begun with over 100 children attending.

mailing-address.narrative: 5604 Jordan Road Bethesda, MD 20816 United States

description.narrative: India is in the midst of a deadly second wave of Covid-19. The daily infection count has gone all-time high. There are horrific stories about lack of oxygen supply resulting in the tragic loss of lives on a daily basis. During these very testing times, IAHV is working with various state governments in India to help procure Oxygen concentrators, Oxygen cylinders and other medical equipment to help the Hospitals. We appeal to you to kindly donate and help during this calamitous time.

mailing-address.narrative: Pear Tree House Upper Hartfield East Sussex TN7 4DX United Kingdom

title.narrative: Daily COVID relief to 250 children in India.

description.narrative: This project will feed 250 children six days a week, that are affected directly by COVID lock down in a town called Vellore, India, with a morning snack and lunch apart from engaging them in activities of academic and recreational value.

mailing-address.narrative: 3/188, Shanthi Nagar, SIH-R & LC, Kandipedu Panchayat, Katpadi Taluk, Vellore District. Vellore, Tamilnadu 632106 India

description.narrative: India is going through the worst humanitarian crisis in centuries. The healthcare system is collapsing. The nation is gasping for breath. Every day the number of patients is over 400,000 and there countless innocent deaths. What are we looking for? Funds for oxygen concentrators, essential medical equipment and their maintenance, nutritious meals for COVID +ve patients, rehabilitation support to farmers & rural women microentrepreneurs, construction of a diagnostic and consultancy centre, etc.

mailing-address.narrative: Mann Deshi Foundation. Mhaswad Tal. Mann Dist.- Satara Mhaswad, Maharashtra 415509 India

description.narrative: India has been witnessing a rapid surge in active COVID-19 cases recording the world's highest number of daily cases over 4 Lakhs. It appears to be a bigger threat than it did during the 1st wave due to its homegrown mutant variant which is proving to be more infectious and deadlier. most of the people are unable to get medical support. In this grave situation we need your donation, that will help to Petain's for treatment and control the second wave of Covid-19 situation.

mailing-address.narrative: Village & P.O: Nandakumarpur, P.S.: Raidighi, Dist.: South 24Parganas, State:West Bengal,PIN: 743349 City Office: 30/9 Rajdanga Main Road, Kolkata-107 Kolkata, West Bengal 743349 India

description.narrative: ISKCON Varanasi with the help of HOPE WELFARE TRUST is helping to arrange free food, medicine, oxygen, etc for people stuck in Hospitals in emergency cases. Old villagers are not able to arrange for basics amenities due to financial constraints. There is a lot of rush in Hospitals, and relatives have to wait with patients to get them to doctors and it becomes very difficult for them to arrange for food, medicine, oxygen, etc leaving the patients alone in an emergency.

mailing-address.narrative: ISKCON Prayagraj, A161 Kashiraj Nagar, Baluaghat Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh 211003 India

title.narrative: COVID Relief for 273 Women & their Families, India

description.narrative: A second Covid-19 wave is devastating families and whole communities across India. The impact will be long-term; WEP's support will be sustainable. WEP has identified 273 students and alumnae and their families (over 1,365 people in all) whose needs have become critical. WEP's strategy is 1. providing dry rations/sanitary goods parcels, kitchen garden seeds and chickens. 2. training on integrating this relief into livelihoods in their homes and communities -WEP Academy Ripple Effect Certificate.

mailing-address.narrative: 244 Fifth Avenue w208 New York, NY 10001 United States

description.narrative: This project wants to respond to the primary needs of food and health security of 150 children and their families who live in Mumbai, who are facing a very dramatic health crisis due to Covid 19.

mailing-address.narrative: via Curiel 21/d Melzo 20066 Italy

title.narrative: COVID-19 Safety and Relief Response in Nepal

description.narrative: As of recent report, the COVID-19 pandemic will push 96 million people into extreme poverty by 2021, 47 million of whom are women and girls. The essential food items & health kits will be great support for poor and marginalized people. These are largely neglected by the COVID-19 related treatment, care and food insufficiency. This campaign can support essential food, basic COVID safety, health and hygiene materials along with sanitary products like face masks, hand washing soap and sanitizers.

mailing-address.narrative: Bishwakarma Chowk, Janakpurdham-4, Dhanusha, Nepal Janakpurdham, Dhanusha 45600 (Janakpur) Nepal

description.narrative: We are providing support to public and charitable hospitals in the city of Mumbai by purchasing the basic medical items they urgently need to offer the appropriate assistance to COVID-19 patients.

mailing-address.narrative: C. Pelai 32, 2 Barcelona 08001 Spain

title.narrative: Support marginalized Indian children through Covid

description.narrative: India is currently witnessing the world's worst coronavirus crisis. The families of Teach For India's 28,000 students are struggling with loss of income, limited access to medical resources and disrupted learning due to school closures. This project aims to provide: a. Food and medical (physical & mental) relief for students' families b. Vaccine support for our Fellows, who are frontline workers serving children c. Learning devices to our students and upskilling Fellows so learning continues

mailing-address.narrative: Teach for India, c/o Godrej Industries Complex, Gate no.2, Phirojshanagar, Vikhroli (E) Mumbai, Maharashtra 400079 India

description.narrative: India is now the global epicentre of the pandemic. People like our project staff and beneficiaries have limited economic resources, and they have to bear the brunt of a collapsing health infrastructure. The girls we work with come from disadvantaged families and cannot afford adequate medical support. Many are even facing to starve with the new lockdown which deprives poor families of their daily wage income. We support families in need of food and medical supplies, can you please help us?

mailing-address.narrative: Herkulesstr. 13a Essen 45127 Germany

description.narrative: Due to another surge of COVID in Bangladesh, Second phase of food relief during month of Ramadan is taking place in Dhaka, Bangladesh to help day laborers, small store owners, teachers, rickshawpullers and others who are suffering immensely from the lockdown and lost their jobs.

mailing-address.narrative: 160 Evergreen Rd Brockport, NY 14420 United States

title.narrative: Support Covid-19 vaccine programme in rural Kenya

description.narrative: There are huge challenges in delivering the COVID-19 vaccine programme to remote areas of rural Kenya. We urgently need your support to reach our most vulnerable. Nobody is safe until everybody is safe. Despite the good news that vaccines have started to arrive in Kenya, we lack basic necessities and face huge logistical challenges in order for us to get the vaccine safely into the arm. This project will ensure Communities will get the vaccination protection they need.

mailing-address.narrative: 4 The Crescent, Millroad Midleton, Cork P25H302 Ireland

title.narrative: Support women in India and Kenya during Covid-19

description.narrative: This project aims to offer social support to 31 women based in Kenya and India who currently work in our organization, Project Tres. The COVID-19 pandemic has hit them and their families hard, making it a huge struggle to continue their own development. Since March 2020, we have been sending money to our teams, primarily so they can access water, food, medicine, and cover their rental costs.

mailing-address.narrative: Luxemburger Str. 5A Berlin, Berlin 13353 Germany

title.narrative: Help Needy in Remote Villages in India Fight COVID

description.narrative: The impact of COVID-19 in India has been highly disruptive, destroying both lives and livelihoods. As we adapt to these unprecedented circumstances, Educate Girls is continuing to serve the most marginalized and vulnerable communities who have been disproportionately affected with the loss of livelihoods, lack of food, poor access to health facilities, sub-optimal education and other basic needs. We were able to impact 500k people and 250k children last year through this. Need is much more now!

mailing-address.narrative: 815, Brazos St. Ste. 500 Austin, TX 78701 United States

title.narrative: Summer is here! Cape CARES back to Honduras!

description.narrative: Fully vaccinated volunteers from Cape CARES are actively planning to return to Honduras in October of this year, 2021, and we plan to serve high priority patients from both San Marocs region and El Rodieto. We will extend our service week to see as many patients as possible. We will be implementing international COVID planning guidelines around social distance and masking, triage and isolation of ill patients.

organisation.narrative: Cape C A R E S Central American Relief Efforts

mailing-address.narrative: po box 709 Rockland, MA 02370 United States

description.narrative: Covid 2nd wave is killing a person every 5 min in Nepal, our health system is at breaking point. People are dying because of lack of oxygen and hospital beds. Infection is spread from Indian boarder to Mt Everest. Therefore it is a critical time to keep our girls and over hundred children and their families safe. Make sure they attend distance learning. Your support will help us prevent them from COVID-19 & provide them with emergency supply, recreational, life skills activities & awareness.

mailing-address.narrative: Dhumbarai-4 Kathmandu Nepal kathmandu 7602 Nepal

description.narrative: The COVID-19 second wave has directly impacted several vulnerable, and marginalised communities in India. The majority of the rural population have no access to better health quality services and they prefer to stay in their villages to recover. The proposed project will provide emergency support like protection kits/home isolation support/covid protection awareness/supplementary nutrition/youth engagement in 5 states of rural India and will reach out to more than 50000 families.

organisation.narrative: Centre for Health and Social Justice

mailing-address.narrative: Basement of Young Women's Hostel No. 2, Near Bank of India, Avenue 21, G Block, Saket New-Delhi 110017 India

title.narrative: COVID Relief and Revival for Women Artisans, India

description.narrative: The project will focus on 700 women artisan families in rural, tribal and peri urban areas Udaipur and Rajsamand districts of South Rajasthan. - The project will provide COVID relief to artisans through food and medical kits; small emergency fund and awareness through volunteers. - Focus on long term livelihood support through generation of home based work, market linkages and fair wages. This project aims to prevent communities from transition into extreme and irreversible poverty.

mailing-address.narrative: Seva Mandir Marg, Old Fatehpura Udaipur, Rajasthan 313004 India

title.narrative: COVID19 - Food and Oxygen for Kolkata's Poorest

description.narrative: This project will provide life-saving emergency oxygen to COVID patients and emergency food parcels to hungry families whose incomes have been badly affected by the coronavirus pandemic. Tiljala SHED's target communities comprise around 5000 families who depend on a daily wage in order to eat. These marginalised communities living in shelters on pavements, beside railway tracks and open sewers are always at the back of the line - a forgotten people. Tiljala SHED puts them first.

organisation.narrative: Tiljala Society for Humans and Educational Development

mailing-address.narrative: 28A Syed Amir Ali Avenue 3rd Floor Kolkata 700017 India

title.narrative: COVID-19 CRISIS SUPPORT FOR 1000 ADOLESCENT GIRLS

description.narrative: Jabala Action Research Organisation intends to support the adolescent girls and their families as they respond to and recover from the Covid-19 crisis. As the situation on the ground is changing rapidly, we are seeking support to carry on relief operations ( Dry ration, OTC drugs, Community Kit, Health Kits) among the 1000beneficiaries in the selected areas of West Bengal & Jharkhand with a primary goal to ensure the adolescent and young women are not adversely affected by this pandemic

mailing-address.narrative: 221/6B RASHBEHARI AVENUE GROUND FLOOR KOLKATA, WEST BENGAL 700019 India

description.narrative: In India, now second wave Covid-19 direct support of health materials such mask, soap, sanitize item and herbal water as prevention of Covid-19 and livelihood support to the daily wage workers families, who lost work and earning. Rural and Tribal women, children and aged persons are getting support. The precaution on the aged people and big awareness and counseling to poor and marginalised people.

mailing-address.narrative: NO: 6, 2ND STREET, SASIKUMAR NAGAR, KANNAMANGALAM KANNAMANGALAM, TAMILNADU 632311 India

title.narrative: Support COVID-19 coronavirus response in Nepal

description.narrative: Over the past few weeks Nepal has faced a new wave of the coronavirus COVID-19, causing an alarmingly large spike in the number of new infections and deaths as it spreads rapidly across the country. Health experts predict that the wave of infections Nepal is currently experiencing is highly likely to follow a similar trajectory to that of India's recent, ongoing second wave. The lives and livelihoods of all the people of Nepal are rapidly and fixedly approaching a crisis point.

organisation.narrative: Association for Dalit Women's Advancement of Nepal

mailing-address.narrative: Shantimarga Baluwatar Kathmandu 44616 Nepal

title.narrative: Saving lives by closing oxygen access gap in India

description.narrative: The second wave of CORONA virus has hit India in a devastating manner crumbling its entire health care system. Importantly, it has thrown up a complex supply challenge-making medical oxygen available across this vast nation on urgent basis. It's logistic nightmare and it takes mammoth effort. In spite of this, lives are being lost. With your support, we will address this bottleneck by setting up four decentralized oxygen generation units next to the COVID centers and save 1000 lives in a year.

mailing-address.narrative: C-36,Krishnarjun, Madhavbaug Society, Shivtirthanagar, Paud Road Pune 411038 India

title.narrative: Help Improve Hygiene of Afghan Street Children

description.narrative: A quarter of kids between the ages of 5 to 14 in Afghanistan suffer child labor - a hazard to their health and well being. Due to poverty and low awareness, hygiene practices are not part of their daily life and therefore, prone to variety of diseases including COVID-19. Awareness raising and supply of basic hygiene materials is the solution. CPD aims to identify street children in districts 9, 10 and 16 of Kabul city and disseminate basic hygiene information and materials for their protection.

mailing-address.narrative: #74, Khurasan Market, Silo road Opposite Shadab Zafar residential blocks Kabul, Kabul province 0101 Afghanistan

title.narrative: Food Packages for 200 Families Impacted by COVID19

description.narrative: This project will provide emergency relief to 200 families affected by COVID-19 and hunger. Recent lockdown measures in Cambodia have aggravated disparities and caused a food security crisis. As of 29 April 2021, Cambodians were ordered to stay home and those who lived in "Red Zones" were prohibited from leaving except to seek medical care. Many people who formerly subsisted on meager wages are now without work. They are in need of food and basic necessities in order to support their families.

mailing-address.narrative: #73 Street 608 Toul Kork Phnom Penh 12152 Cambodia

title.narrative: Lesedi la Batho Social Relief Fund, South Africa

description.narrative: Lesedi la Batho ("Light for the People") offers social relief and hope for people living in poverty-stricken, underserved areas of our community with little opportunity to improve their lives and become independent of hand outs. We believe every person has the right to basic commodities and the ability to provide for their children. The strains and restrictions of the COVID-19 pandemic devastated families who were already struggling - and they need a helping hand now more than ever before.

mailing-address.narrative: Lesedi la Batho Community Centre 3217 Block B Mabopane, Gauteng 0190 South Africa

title.narrative: Joining hands for responding to COVID-19 Impacts!

description.narrative: Marginalized communities are left with little help during this time of the COVID-19 pandemic. With everything closed down, food and hygiene supplies have come forward as essentials. Therefore, collaborating with multiple community organizations and local stakeholders, Visible Impact aims to distribute food rations and hygiene supplies to vulnerable and marginalized communities.

mailing-address.narrative: 212/48 Dhapasi Marga, Basundhara Kathmandu, Kathmandu 44600 Nepal

description.narrative: COVID-19 outbreaks in Taiwan. The national Level 3 COVID alert is extended continuously. Many vulnerable families were already in financial difficulties have a harder life. The sudden drop in income due to the epidemic has forced families to lose their meals and income, and they cannot apply the government's bailout grant. Through COVID-19 Funds for 3500 vulnerable families and 200 vulnerable children, hoping to be their urgent and timely support and continue their learning at home.

mailing-address.narrative: 9F.-2, No.4, Ln. 609, Sec. 5, Chongxin Rd., Sanchong Dist. New Taipei City, Taiwan 24159 China-Taiwan

title.narrative: Support families struggling with hunger in Puebla.

description.narrative: Food is a basic and fundamental human right - it is essential. However, in Mexico, every day there are more than 50 million people that do not have enough food in order to live a healthy and active life. On top of that, the COVID-19 virus has increased the hunger problem around the world. Due to this situation, we are looking for international help. With only $20 dollars, you can ensure food for a whole family during an entire month.

organisation.narrative: Fundacion de Beneficencia Privada Banco de Alimentos Caritas Puebla

mailing-address.narrative: Camino Viejo a Tlaxcala, Parque Industrial Ocotlan, Coronango Puebla Puebla 72680 Mexico

description.narrative: Nepal is overwhelmed by COVID-19 at the moment. There are no more hospital beds, medicine or oxygen. With the country in lockdown, daily wage earners have no work and so cannot buy food and they and their families are going hungry. This project will raise money to provide protective equipment, emergency food parcels for the children, families and communities we support. Everything we can do to keep the people of Nepal safe and stop the spread of Coronavirus will make a real difference.

mailing-address.narrative: St Clement's 1 St Clement's Court London EC4N 7HB United Kingdom

title.narrative: Nepal Rapid Response Program to 2nd Wave of COVID

description.narrative: Across the country, people are dying in rural and urban areas alike for lack of basic medical treatment & basic food supplies. Like the devastating 2015 earthquakes, the present COVID-19 humanitarian crisis in Nepal was both highly predictable and without a bold intervention, will, tragically, recur. Similarly, most of the rural women communities of the Terai districts of Nepal have started to reel under the following problems due to the 2nd wave of COVID 19.

organisation.narrative: THE HIMALAYAN GRASSROOTS WOMEN'S NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ASSOCIATION OF NEPAL (HIMAWANTI NEPAL)

mailing-address.narrative: Jwagal-10, Lalitpur, Nepal Lalitpur 977 Nepal

title.narrative: COVID support to families of conservation warriors

description.narrative: The second wave of COVID-19 in India has devastated entire families with very high infection and mortality rates. In all the lockdowns imposed, frontline forest staff continue to foot-patrol their beats. Unlike most of us, they cannot work from home. In March and April 2021, we have lost at least 10 frontline forest staff besides many other conservation beacons to COVID-19. This appeal is to honour their life committed to conservation and provide immediate ex-gratia support to their next-of-kin.

mailing-address.narrative: F-13, Sector 8, Noida, Uttar Pradesh 201301 India

title.narrative: Nepal Covid-19 Care, Save Lives in Karnali & More

description.narrative: PHASE has been strengthening basic primary care and maternity services via government health posts with a team of its medical staff in remote regions of Mugu, Humla and Bajura of Karnali area along with remote areas of Gorkha and Sindhupalchok districts. Recently these remote villages have become the hotspot of covid-19with several hundred people ill and several deaths. PHASE aims to provide lifesaving support to them by setting up resourceful isolation beds with oxygen, medicine & staff support

mailing-address.narrative: Kathmandu - 9, Sinamangal Kathmandu, Kathmandu GPO Box: 12888 Nepal

title.narrative: Go Girl against teen pregnancy due to covid 19

description.narrative: Under the name Go Girl, partners of The Constellation in Cameroon, Ghana, India, Indonesia and Kenya have joined hands after signalling a growth in (unwanted) teen pregnancy in their countries. The same thing is happening in several places in the world, possibly as a result of school closures and other lockdown measures in response to the covid-19 pandemic. In those locations girls drop out of school and their health, livelihood and safety is at risk. A cultural sensitive intervention is needed.

mailing-address.narrative: Houtmankade 72-3 Amsterdam 1013 MZ Netherlands

title.narrative: Goma Volcano Child Protection & Relief Fund

description.narrative: On May 22, the Nyiragongo volcano erupted, causing the evacuation of thousands from surrounding villages in Goma and more than 170 children feared missing.We will provide immediate assistance to children and evacuees affected by the volcanic eruption and already battling with COVID-19 in a region and armed conflict. Our relief assistance will include volcano awareness, food packages, clean water, hygiene kits, sanitary products, clothing, heavy-duty face masks, relocation and housing support.

mailing-address.narrative: Immeuble RYAN, 3eme Niveau, 4 Avenue du Marche, Commune de la Gombe Kinshasa, Kinshasa 981 Kinshasa 1 Congo, Democratic Republic of the

title.narrative: Global Covid Emergency! - Oxygen On Demand

description.narrative: Emergency Oxygen - The Appropriate Technology Collaborative is making an oxygen concentrator for Covid relief. Millions of people in India, Africa and Asia are now suffocating due to lack of oxygen. Hospitals are over run with Covid patients. The situation is dire, but Covid patients, if given oxygen early on, can recover at home. Home oxygen means fewer patients are hospitalized and fewer are intubated. Oxygen is essential. Let's help local people take control and make their own oxygen.

mailing-address.narrative: 3796 Plaza Dr. Ann Arbor, MI 48108 United States

title.narrative: Send 300 Girls Back to School (COVID Recovery)

description.narrative: In India, 250 million people have been pushed into extreme poverty over the past 15 months. According to the UN, 20 million girls worldwide who have left school will never return. This project will send 300 of the girls we serve, survivors of trafficking and those at high-risk, back to school to ensure they do not become a part of that statistic. Girls living in poverty or in high-risk environments cannot afford to lose the progress they have made in school. Education, Not Exploitation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 3403 St Augustine, FL 32085 United States

title.narrative: Emergency Response to COVID-19 in Sri Lanka

description.narrative: Street Child will deliver and support ground level relief efforts in Mullaitivu, Batticaloa and Trincomalee by contributing towards urgent non-medical items for frontline workers in intermediate care centres (ICC), necessary personal protective equipment (PPE) to protect households and encourage safe hygiene practices and emergency food relief packages to families of daily wage workers facing existential challenges during the lockdown due to Sri Lanka's second wave of COVID-19.

mailing-address.narrative: Street Child 206 - 208 Stewart's Road London SW8 4UB United Kingdom

title.narrative: COVID-19 Relief for Brazil, Columbia and Bolivia

description.narrative: The Covid-19 crisis in South America has taken an alarming turn, with cases increasing in Brazil, Columbia, and Bolivia. Hospitals are overwhelmed and there have been reports of oxygen shortages and insufficient hospital beds. There are urgent calls for more beds, medicines, oxygen, essential drugs and Covid-19 tests. Hospitals are overwhelmed and are running out of ICU beds and other critical medical equipment.

mailing-address.narrative: 1220 L St NW Suite 725 Washington, DC 20005 United States

title.narrative: Help the Tharu Prevent a COVID disaster in Nepal

description.narrative: The Advocacy Project is seeking $2,500 to help our partner, Backward Society Education (BASE), fight back against a devastating second wave of the coronavirus in Midwest Nepal. Drawing on its roots in the Tharu community, BASE will work in 60 villages and train volunteers to lead a prevention campaign, as well as deploy a mobile medical team to conduct rapid testing and provide emergency care. We hope to reach over 12,000 villagers and set up a system that could eventually support vaccinations.

mailing-address.narrative: 2201 P Street Nw # 204 Washington, DC 20037 United States
